title: Charlie Kirk Assassination - Austin Peay State University

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Charlie Kirk Assassination - Austin Peay State University
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any COMMUNICATIONS (defined below) sent to or from any of the UNIVERSITY STAFF (defined below) concerning Charlie Kirk, Darren Michael, or otherwise including any of the following Terms: "Kirk", "Darren Michael", “First Amendment”, “free speech”, “freedom of speech”, or “incitement”.

2. Any COMMUNICATIONS between any Austin Peay State University administrators or staff in their official capacities (including any of the UNIVERSITY STAFF) and any GOVERNMENT OFFICIAL (defined below) concerning Charlie Kirk or Darren Michael. This request does not include students, faculty, or communications sent or received in the personal capacity of a staff member or administrator.

3. Any policy concerning faculty, staff, or student use of social media.

Please note that Request Nos. are limited to records generated on or between September 10-18, 2025.

"COMMUNICATIONS" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

"UNIVERSITY STAFF" means and includes: President Michael Licari; Chief of Staff and Secretary of the Board of Trustees Carol Clark; Chief of Strategic Communication Ginna Holleman; Vice President for Alumni, Engagement, and Philanthropy Kris Phillips; Executive Assistant Lenora P. Jackson; Assistant to the Chief of Staff Brandie Duke; Board of Trustees Chair Mike O'Malley; and Board Vice-Chair Phil Roe.

"GOVERNMENT OFFICIAL" means and includes: Member of Congress, Member of the Tennessee General Assembly, Governor, Lieutenant Governor, or Attorney General, or any employee or agent of the foregoing.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Adam Steinbaugh.

title: Plymouth, Massachusetts: Arrest at Charlie Kirk vigil

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Plymouth, Massachusetts: Arrest at Charlie Kirk vigil
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. All body-worn camera footage recorded by any Plymouth Police Department personnel on or immediately before the evening of September 14, 2025, at or around the Massachusetts State Public Park documenting (a) the events surrounding the vigil and the alleged disruption of the vigil by Christopher Lennon and/or any other persons, (B) any disputes or conflicts between any persons present near the area, (c) any acts taken by or speech uttered by Mr. Lennon; (d) any acts or speech by others directed at Mr. Lennon; and (e) any interaction with Mr. Lennon by Department personnel, including but not limited to, the investigation, arrest, booking, and detention of Mr. Lennon;

2. All dash camera footage from any patrol vehicles at or around the Massachusetts State Public Park on or immediately before the evening of September 14, 2025; and

3. All documents concerning the vigil held at the Massachusetts State Public Park on September 14, including but not limited to documents concerning permitting, event security, ordinances related to public disruption or noise regulation, interactions among those present at or around the vigil, the investigation and arrest of Mr. Lennon, the charges brought against Mr. Lennon, any charges considered or brought against any other person at or around the vigil, and Mr. Lennon's booking and detention. This request includes official Department documents, including but not limited to police reports and charging documents, and unofficial documents including but not limited to written notes and voice memos.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: ChatGPT usage
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Chat histories of all ChatGPT sessions conducted by city employees on city-owned devices or used in job-related functions in City Clerk's office. The timeframe for this request is 1/1/2023 to the date this request is filed. 

ChatGPT logs can be accessed through the following steps: 
1. **Click on your name or profile icon** (bottom-left corner of the ChatGPT interface).
2. Select **"Settings"**.
3. Go to the **"Data Controls"** tab.
4. Click **"Export data"**.
5. A pop-up will appear — click **"Confirm export"**.
6. OpenAI will email you a download link with a `.zip` file containing your chat history in JSON format (and HTML for easy viewing).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kelly Kauffman

Chat histories of all ChatGPT sessions conducted by city employees on city-owned devices or used in job-related functions in the Kansas City Police Department. The timeframe for this request is 1/1/2023 to the date this request is filed. 

ChatGPT logs can be accessed through the following steps: 
1. **Click on your name or profile icon** (bottom-left corner of the ChatGPT interface).
2. Select **"Settings"**.
3. Go to the **"Data Controls"** tab.
4. Click **"Export data"**.
5. A pop-up will appear — click **"Confirm export"**.
6. OpenAI will email you a download link with a `.zip` file containing your chat history in JSON format (and HTML for easy viewing).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Kelly Kauffman

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications sent to or from Brendan Carr, Scott Delacourt, Greg Watson, Adam Jackman, Dana Howell, Rhonda Hill, or Carlos Minnix which mention any of the following terms: Kimmel, ABC, Nexstar, Sinclair, Kirk, "public interest", "news distortion", "Center for American Rights",  "black face", "blackface", or "First Amendment".

This request is limited to records generated on or between September 10-17, 2025.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 47 CFR § 0.461(h) and (h)(3)(ii) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and academic freedom, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely FCC Chairman Brendan Carr's efforts to pressure a media outlet to remove a comedian from television.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, as well as repeated public comments from Brendan Carr, evidencing his determination that the matter is one of public concern.

Examples of coverage and commentary demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include:

a. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/09/17/business/media/abc-jimmy-kimmel.html
b. https://www.cnn.com/2025/09/17/media/jimmy-kimmel-charlie-kirk-trump-fcc-brendan-carr
c. https://www.foxnews.com/media/fcc-chair-levels-threat-against-abc-disney-after-kimmel-suggested-charlie-kirk-assassin-maga
d. https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c203n52x1y9o
e. https://variety.com/2025/tv/news/brendan-carr-abc-fcc-jimmy-kimmel-charlie-kirk-1236522406/
f. https://www.politico.com/news/2025/09/17/disney-jimmy-kimmel-live-kirk-00570355
g. https://x.com/BrendanCarrFCC/status/1968449919221416427
h. https://x.com/brianstelter/status/1968449834697834591

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I am willing to pay upward of $500 for these materials. However, I request, under 47 CFR § 0.461(e) a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to controversial conduct by the Chairman of the FCC.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Charles Robert Redford Jr. (August 18, 1936 – September 16, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into filmmaker Charles Robert Redford Jr. (August 18, 1936 – September 16, 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/09/16/movies/robert-redford-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: FOIA Request – Secret Service Coordination for Air Force Two Transport of Charlie Kirk’s Casket

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request – Secret Service Coordination for Air Force Two Transport of Charlie Kirk’s Casket
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request all records related to the U.S. Secret Service’s role in coordinating, approving, or supporting the transport of Charlie Kirk’s casket aboard Air Force Two from Utah to Phoenix on or about September 11, 2025. Specifically, I request:

Interagency coordination documents or memoranda related to Secret Service planning or involvement.

Any communications with the Department of Defense, Department of the Air Force, or the Office of the Vice President regarding this mission.

Cost documents reflecting any Secret Service expenses directly allocated to this mission (e.g., overtime, travel, or protection details).

I understand that sensitive security procedures may be exempt from disclosure. I request redacted or sanitized copies of records where necessary, rather than complete withholding.

Format Requested: Electronic (PDF or searchable).

Fee Category: Request for media/non-commercial use, with fee waiver on grounds of strong public interest.

Expedited Processing: Requested due to immediate and ongoing public interest in this high-profile event.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous Bloomer

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request – Records Related to Air Force Two Transport of Charlie Kirk’s Casket
communications.communication:

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement - AF 2025-08129-F
communications.communication:
Dear Anonymous  Bloomer, 
This is to acknowledge receipt of your September 17, 2025, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request for "the following records:I request all records related to the use of Air Force Two for the transport of Charlie Kirk’s casket from Utah to Phoenix on or about September 11, 2025. Specifically, I request:Flight records/logs documenting the mission, including the mission number, departure and arrival times, and flight hours.Cost records or documents reflecting expenses allocated specifically to this mission (fuel, crew hours, aircraft operations, and support costs), to the extent such expenses are separately tracked.Passenger lists identifying government officials or persons of public record aboard." (Date Range for Record Search: From 09/11/2025 To 09/17/2025). Based on our initial review, we believe we cannot process your request within the statutory 20 workdays because our organization has a significant number of pending FOIA requests.  To ensure all requesters are properly served in the order their requests were received, we have instituted multitrack processing of requests.  Based on the information you provided, we have placed your request in the complex track. The Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) provides for the collection of fees based on the costs of processing a FOIA request and your fee category.  Based upon the information provided in your request, we have placed you in the Other category. We have assigned number 2025-08129-F to identify your request; should you need to contact us about your request.  Please direct your questions to the HAF FOIA team at SAF.AA.HAF.FOIA.Workflow@us.af.mil and use this assigned number to assist us in responding more promptly. We will strive to provide an update between 90 and 120 days.  Our policy is to process requests within their respective tracks in the order in which they were received in accordance with 32 CFR, Part 286.8.  We will notify you in writing if additional processing time is required.  We do process each FOIA request as quickly as possible, however delayed responses can be expected. Very Respectfully, SAF/AMGI FOIA TEAM Office of the Secretary of the Air Force 1000 Air Force Pentagon Washington, DC 20330-1000

title: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Drug Free Zone Sentence Enhancements: Department of Correction, NY

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Drug Free Zone Sentence Enhancements: Department of Correction, NY
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all records related to persons serving or who have served a sentence for a state drug free zone law violation – under Consolidated Laws of New York, Penal 220.34. Specifically, I am requesting a list of all people currently or formerly incarcerated for a drug-free zone violation from 2015 to 6/30/2024. The list should include names, date of conviction, date of end of sentence, offenses convicted of, inmate ID, facility type (ie. state prison, local jail) and parole eligibility date.I would also like to request any demographic information that may be readily available for the above persons, such as, but not limited to, each person’s date of birth, age at arrest, current age, race, ethnicity and gender. If this time frame is overly burdensome, please provide a date range that can be fulfilled.
In addition, I am requesting a copy of any and all reports or studies generated by the state that discuss the passage and efficacy of the drug free zone law.
If there are any fees for obtaining or copying these records, please inform me should the cost exceed $100. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees as I am requesting the information on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of drug free zone laws. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.
If possible, please provide the requested documents electronically in Excel format. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records. Further, if you expect a significant delay in responding to this request, please contact me with information concerning when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption that justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Angel Carter

title: Narrowed California Public Records Act Request — CALEA Logs, ECI/EDI, Vendor Contracts

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Narrowed California Public Records Act Request — CALEA Logs, ECI/EDI, Vendor Contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Custodian of Records,



This is a follow-up to my prior CPRA request (acknowledged on August 26, 2025). I am narrowing scope to ensure clarity and compliance with California Government Code §7920.000 et seq.



I request records from January 1, 2020 to present relating to the disclosure, handling, or use of subscriber/location identifiers tied to my account and devices, including ECI (E-UTRAN Cell Identifier), EDI, IMSI, IMEI, ICCID, and MSISDN. Please search for the following categories:









1. CALEA / Intercept Compliance Logs





-   Records showing disclosure of subscriber identifiers to law enforcement under the Communications Assistance for Law Enforcement Act (CALEA).
-   Log entries, audit trails, or chain-of-custody records indicating whether my identifiers (see below) were disclosed, including date, requesting agency, and receiving endpoint.











2. Third-Party Vendors / Contractors





-   Contracts, invoices, purchase orders, statements of work, or MOUs between Ventura County Sheriff’s Office and surveillance or forensic vendors, including but not limited to:
    

-   Persistent Surveillance Systems (PSS)
-   L3Harris (Stingray, Hailstorm, Dirtbox)
-   Palantir
-   Magnet Forensics
-   Cellebrite
-   Berla iVe
-   Oxygen Forensics

-   Pegasus 
    
-   Records evidencing sharing of subscriber/location identifiers with these vendors, whether directly or through agency task forces.











3. Policies & Procedures





-   Any policies, SOPs, or internal legal guidance describing when subscriber metadata (ECI/EDI, IMSI/IMEI, MSISDN) may be shared with third-party vendors or contractors.









Identifiers for Search:



-   Full Name: Adonis Gaynor
-   DOB: 11-09-1975
-   Phone Numbers: 213 392-3314
-   IMSI: 
-   IMEI: 356847113266971/356847113307791
-   ICCID: 89148000008530814783
-   VIN: JTDZN3EU9C3154263
-   LICENSE: 6XCF063









If records are withheld under a claimed exemption, please:



1.  Identify the statutory basis, and
2.  Provide an index or Vaughn-style description sufficient for me to evaluate the claim.

Litigation Hold Notice – Preservation of Records



This notice serves as a formal litigation hold. The Ventura County Sheriff’s Office is instructed to immediately preserve and suspend destruction of all records, logs, communications, and contracts from January 1, 2020 to present relating to:



-   CALEA compliance logs, lawful intercept records, disclosure logs, chain-of-custody records, and audit trails referencing subscriber identifiers (ECI, EDI, IMSI, IMEI, ICCID, MSISDN).
-   Contracts, invoices, MOUs, purchase orders, and statements of work with surveillance or forensic vendors, including but not limited to: Persistent Surveillance Systems (PSS), L3Harris (Stingray/Hailstorm/Dirtbox), Palantir, Magnet Forensics, Cellebrite, Berla iVe, Oxygen Forensics.
-   Internal policies, legal guidance, emails, and communications discussing subscriber identifier disclosures, CALEA compliance, or vendor usage.





This duty to preserve extends to all employees, contractors, task forces, and third parties under the Sheriff’s Office’s control.



Failure to preserve these records may constitute spoliation of evidence and can result in legal sanctions.



Please confirm in writing that this hold has been implemented.





Please provide responsive records on a rolling basis as they are identified.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mr. adonis gaynor

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Drug Free Zone Sentence Enhancements: Hawaii Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation
communications.communication:
Our office received the request below and will need additional time to gather the information. The information you seek is not readily available and will require a manual search, review, and segregation time.

Pursuant to HRS §92F, and the Office of information Practices Administrative Rules, §2-71- 19, when a person requests access to a government record under Part II of Chapter 92F, HRS, the agency may charge the requester:

(a) (1) Fees for searching, reviewing, and segregating the record; provided that these fees shall be assessed in accordance with this chapter; and
(b) An agency may require a requester to prepay the following before an agency begins the search for and review of records in order to respond to a request for access:

(1) Fifty percent of the total estimated fees for searching, for reviewing, and segregating records when the estimated fees exceed $30;
(2) One hundred percent of the estimated fees from previous requests, including abandoned requests, in accordance with subsection (d).

Accordingly, in any request for information to DCR, the following charges apply for responsive documents: 1) @2.50 for each 15-minute period of search time; 2) $5.00 for each 15-minute period of review time and segregation; and 3) $0.50 per page for documents copied/digitized.  The cost related to your request will be provided once the DCR can estimate the time to research and segregate data.

Thank you,
Cheyenne Evans
Department of Corrections & Rehabilitation
Litigation Coordination Office
Acting Departmental Program Officer / PREA Coordinator
Certified DOJ PREA Auditor
1177 Alakea St.
Honolulu, HI 96813

If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any retention, dissemination, distribution, or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited. title: California Public Records Act Request: Drug Free Zone Sentence Enhancements: California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation, Office of Audits and Court Compliance

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: California Public Records Act Request: Drug Free Zone Sentence Enhancements: California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation, Office of Audits and Court Compliance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all records related to persons serving or who have served a sentence for a state drug free zone law violation – under Ann.Cal.Health & Safety Code 11353.5, 11353.7. Specifically, I am requesting a list of all people currently or formerly incarcerated for a drug-free zone violation from 2015 to 6/30/2024. The list should include names, date of conviction, date of end of sentence, offenses convicted of, inmate ID, facility type (ie. state prison, local jail) and parole eligibility date.I would also like to request any demographic information that may be readily available for the above persons, such as, but not limited to, each person’s date of birth, age at arrest, current age, race, ethnicity and gender. If this time frame is overly burdensome, please provide a date range that can be fulfilled.
In addition, I am requesting a copy of any and all reports or studies generated by the state that discuss the passage and efficacy of the drug free zone law.
If there are any fees for obtaining or copying these records, please inform me should the cost exceed $100. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees as I am requesting the information on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of drug free zone laws. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.
If possible, please provide the requested documents electronically in Excel format. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records. Further, if you expect a significant delay in responding to this request, please contact me with information concerning when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption that justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Angel Carter

title: Police Information Sharing Policies with Immigration Authorities (Burlington Police Department)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Police Information Sharing Policies with Immigration Authorities (Burlington Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records: 

1. All departmental or municipal policies regarding communication and information sharing between departmental officers or employees and federal agents/agencies within the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) or the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), including but not limited to the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). The records request includes, but is not limited to, policies regarding: 

A. Fingerprint and other data sharing, 

B. ICE detainer requests,   

C. Compliance with federal immigration enforcement efforts, including guidance or policies around when communication with ICE officers is allowed, and 

D. Communicating with federal immigration enforcement officers. 

This request covers any policies that are currently in effect or that have been in effect at any point on or after January 20, 2025. 

2. The three most recent communications (e.g., emails, text messages, call logs or transcripts, or otherwise) between a departmental officer or employee and a federal DHS or ICE employee. In addition, I request all records related to these communications, including, but not limited to, any records indicating that the department was made aware of the communications, discussions of their content or implications, evaluations them for compliance with departmental or other city policies, identification or acknowledgement of any potential policy violations, and any internal responses, disciplinary actions, or follow-up measures resulting from these communications. 

3. All records relating to incidents, if any, from January 20, 2025, to the day this request is responded to, in which an individual was taken from the department’s custody directly into ICE custody. For each incident, the records request includes, but is not limited to, booking and transfer records, communications with ICE or other federal agencies, internal documentation or discussion of the transfer, and internal notes, memos, or documentation referencing communication with DHS or ICE.

For each request, I am not seeking identifying information, and I will accept anonymized or redacted data as necessary to protect identities. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest. I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Joshua Dankoff 

Joshuadankoff@cfjj.org  

Director of Strategic Initiatives 

Citizens for Juvenile Justice  

(submitted via MuckRock platform)
